The Coming of the Elves and the Making of Kôr

wikitext.*:
'''Falassë Númëa''' was the western shore of [[Tol Eressëa]], according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] in ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]''. In these shores and beaches, the [[Solosimpi]] sailed in hosts upon their [[swanships]].<ref>{{LT1|V}}, p. 124</ref>

== Etymology ==
The name ''Falassë Númëa'' is in [[Qenya]], meaning the "Western Surf".<ref>{{LT1|Appendix}}, p. 253</ref> It is a combination of ''[[falassë]]'' ("shore, beach, surf") + ''[[númëa]]'' ("in the west, western").<ref>{{webcite|author=[[Paul Strack]]|articleurl=http://eldamo.org/content/words/word-1375836239.html|articlename=ᴱQ. ''Falasse Númea'' loc.|website=Eldamo|accessed=29 April 2022}}</ref>
